title: Prayer as a Practice of Self-Realization in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of prayer in Timorese spirituality, as described in the module?
choices: To ask for material blessings
To communicate with ancestors only
As a means of self-discovery and connection to the divine
To fulfill religious obligations
questions.answer: As a means of self-discovery and connection to the divine

questions.question: Which two main spiritual traditions have influenced prayer practices in Timor-Leste?
choices: Buddhism and Hinduism
Islam and Judaism
Catholicism and indigenous beliefs
Protestantism and Confucianism
questions.answer: Catholicism and indigenous beliefs

questions.question: What is the term used for the Timorese meditative practice of 'finding inner peace'?
choices: Tara bandu
Hakmatek
Lulik
Novena
questions.answer: Hakmatek

questions.question: How does Timorese prayer practice often differ from more individualistic approaches?
choices: It emphasizes solitary meditation
It focuses on personal gain
It emphasizes community and collective spiritual experience
It rejects traditional rituals
questions.answer: It emphasizes community and collective spiritual experience

questions.question: What role do ancestors play in Timorese prayer practices?
choices: They are ignored in favor of monotheistic beliefs
They are seen as evil spirits to be avoided
They are viewed as active participants in daily life
They are only remembered on specific holidays
questions.answer: They are viewed as active participants in daily life

questions.question: How is prayer integrated into daily life in Timor-Leste?
choices: It is confined to formal religious settings
It is only practiced on weekends
It is woven into everyday activities
It is discouraged outside of churches
questions.answer: It is woven into everyday activities

questions.question: What is a common thread between Catholic and indigenous prayer practices in Timor-Leste?
choices: Emphasis on individual achievement
Focus on material prosperity
Rejection of traditional beliefs
Emphasis on community and collective experience
questions.answer: Emphasis on community and collective experience

questions.question: How do many Timorese Catholics engage in contemplative prayer?
choices: Through loud chanting
By avoiding scripture
Through meditation on scripture or silent reflection
By rejecting traditional Catholic practices
questions.answer: Through meditation on scripture or silent reflection

questions.question: What is the concept of 'lulik' in indigenous Timorese beliefs?
choices: A type of food offering
A sacred or taboo concept
A prayer technique
A type of religious building
questions.answer: A sacred or taboo concept

questions.question: How do indigenous Timorese beliefs view the relationship between humans and nature?
choices: As separate and unrelated
As interconnected and harmonious
As adversarial
As irrelevant to spiritual practice
questions.answer: As interconnected and harmonious

questions.question: What is one way that Timorese prayer practices aim to foster self-realization?
choices: By encouraging material accumulation
By promoting social isolation
By transcending the individual ego
By rejecting all forms of spirituality
questions.answer: By transcending the individual ego

questions.question: How has Timor-Leste's history of conflict influenced its prayer practices?
choices: It has led to the abandonment of all spiritual practices
It has resulted in prayer being used as a tool for healing and resilience
It has caused a complete shift to atheism
It has had no impact on spiritual practices
questions.answer: It has resulted in prayer being used as a tool for healing and resilience

questions.question: What is a challenge faced by younger generations in Timor-Leste regarding prayer practices?
choices: Complete rejection of all spiritual practices
Forced adherence to traditional methods only
Integrating ancient wisdom with contemporary life
Mandatory conversion to a single religion
questions.answer: Integrating ancient wisdom with contemporary life

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often view the concept of self?
choices: As completely separate from the divine
As unchangeable and fixed
As part of a greater interconnected whole
As superior to nature and community
questions.answer: As part of a greater interconnected whole

questions.question: What is the significance of offering prayers before planting or fishing in Timorese culture?
choices: It is seen as a superstitious practice with no real meaning
It serves as a reminder of the spiritual dimension in everyday life
It is only done to appease local authorities
It is a recent practice introduced by foreign missionaries
questions.answer: It serves as a reminder of the spiritual dimension in everyday life

questions.question: How does the concept of self-realization through prayer in Timor-Leste relate to community?
choices: Self-realization is seen as completely separate from community
Community is viewed as an obstacle to self-realization
Self-realization is intimately connected to one's relationships with others
Community is irrelevant in Timorese spiritual practices
questions.answer: Self-realization is intimately connected to one's relationships with others

questions.question: What is the role of silence in Timorese prayer practices?
choices: It is discouraged in favor of constant verbal prayer
It is seen as a sign of disrespect
It is used as a meditative tool for self-reflection
It is only practiced by Catholic nuns and monks
questions.answer: It is used as a meditative tool for self-reflection

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often approach the concept of time?
choices: By focusing solely on the future
By ignoring the past completely
By connecting past, present, and future through ancestor veneration
By rejecting any notion of time in spiritual practice
questions.answer: By connecting past, present, and future through ancestor veneration

questions.question: What is the significance of nature in Timorese prayer practices?
choices: Nature is seen as separate from spiritual practice
Nature is viewed as a backdrop for prayer with no spiritual significance
Nature is often integrated into prayer as a connection to the divine
Nature is considered an obstacle to true spiritual growth
questions.answer: Nature is often integrated into prayer as a connection to the divine

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often view the relationship between the physical and spiritual worlds?
choices: As completely separate and unrelated
As interconnected and influencing each other
As antagonistic forces
As identical with no distinction
questions.answer: As interconnected and influencing each other

questions.question: What is the attitude towards syncretism in Timorese spiritual practices?
choices: It is strictly forbidden
It is reluctantly tolerated
It is actively embraced, blending Catholic and indigenous elements
It is only practiced by a small minority
questions.answer: It is actively embraced, blending Catholic and indigenous elements

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often approach the concept of the divine?
choices: As a distant, unreachable entity
As something to be feared and appeased
As a presence that can be experienced through self-realization
As a concept irrelevant to daily life
questions.answer: As a presence that can be experienced through self-realization

questions.question: What role does ritual play in Timorese prayer practices?
choices: Rituals are seen as outdated and discouraged
Rituals are only performed by religious leaders
Rituals are used as tools for connecting with the divine and ancestors
Rituals are performed without any spiritual significance
questions.answer: Rituals are used as tools for connecting with the divine and ancestors

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often view the concept of personal transformation?
choices: As unnecessary for spiritual growth
As something that only happens after death
As a continuous process facilitated by prayer and reflection
As a one-time event that occurs at birth
questions.answer: As a continuous process facilitated by prayer and reflection

questions.question: What is the significance of offerings in Timorese prayer practices?
choices: They are seen as bribes to spiritual entities
They are considered unnecessary and discouraged
They serve as symbolic acts of devotion and connection
They are only practiced in formal religious settings
questions.answer: They serve as symbolic acts of devotion and connection

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often approach the concept of suffering?
choices: As something to be ignored or denied
As a punishment for wrongdoing
As an opportunity for spiritual growth and understanding
As the ultimate goal of spiritual practice
questions.answer: As an opportunity for spiritual growth and understanding

questions.question: What is the attitude towards diversity of prayer practices in Timor-Leste?
choices: Only one form of prayer is accepted
Diversity is seen as a threat to spiritual unity
Various prayer practices are respected and often integrated
Prayer diversity is discouraged by religious authorities
questions.answer: Various prayer practices are respected and often integrated

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often view the relationship between the individual and the cosmos?
choices: As completely separate and unrelated
As antagonistic forces
As a microcosm reflecting the macrocosm
As irrelevant to spiritual practice
questions.answer: As a microcosm reflecting the macrocosm

questions.question: What is the role of language in Timorese prayer practices?
choices: Only one sacred language is used for all prayers
Language is seen as irrelevant in prayer
Multiple languages are often used, reflecting cultural diversity
Silent prayer is the only accepted form
questions.answer: Multiple languages are often used, reflecting cultural diversity

questions.question: How do Timorese prayer practices often approach the concept of time in spiritual growth?
choices: Spiritual growth is seen as instantaneous
Time is irrelevant in spiritual matters
Spiritual growth is viewed as a gradual, lifelong process
Spiritual growth can only occur at specific, predetermined times
questions.answer: Spiritual growth is viewed as a gradual, lifelong process
